appDescription: Linked Events is a collection of software components and API endpoints that enables event management and distribution for different event providers in Finland.

errors.authorizationRequired: Sign in to use this feature
errors.forbidden: You do not have permission to use this feature.
errors.validationError: The form has errors. Please check the form.

cancelEventModal.text1: This action will cancel the event. You can also postpone the event or delete an event you may have inputted accidentally.
cancelEventModal.text2: The following events will be cancelled:
cancelEventModal.textPastEventAreNotUpdated: Please note the changes are only applied to future events in the series. Events in the past will not be cancelled when cancelling an umbrella event.
cancelEventModal.title: Confirm event cancellation
cancelEventModal.titlePastEventAreNotUpdated: Past events in series will not be cancelled
cancelEventModal.warning: Instead of cancelling, do note, you can also host the event remotely. Select the option “internet” on the event form. You also have the option to postpone the event.

deleteEventModal.text1: This action will permanently remove the event.
deleteEventModal.text2: If necessary, you can cancel or postpone the event.
deleteEventModal.text3: The following events will be deleted:
deleteEventModal.title: Confirm event deletion

buttonPanel.warningNoRightsToCreate: You do not have permission to create this event.
buttonPanel.warningNoRightsToPublish: You do not have permission to publish this event.
buttonPanel.warningNotAuthenticated: If you want to publish this event, you must first login.

form.checkboxIsVerified: I verify that the information I have provided is correct and I undertake to comply with all instructions and regulations concerning the courses and events of the City of Helsinki.
form.eventDraftStateInfo: The saved information will automatically be visible to the moderator as well. However, the information can be edited until the moderator publishes the event. The latter can be avoided by writing "UNFINISHED" at the beginning of the event title while editing is in progress.

editButtonPanel.warningCannotPublishSubEvent: A sub event of a series cannot be published.
editButtonPanel.warningNoRightsToEdit: You have insufficient rights to edit this event.
editButtonPanel.warningNoEmailFound: Could not find email address linked to this event

form.helperUmbrellaEvent: Note. An umbrella event must be created before you can add subevents to it.

infoTextAttendeeCapacity.course: If the number of participants in the course is limited, specify the minimum and maximum number of participants here.
infoTextAttendeeCapacity.general: If the number of participants in the event is limited, specify the minimum and maximum number of participants here.
infoTextAttendeeCapacity.volunteering: If the number of participants in the volunteering is limited, specify the minimum and maximum number of participants here.

form.infoTextAttendeeCapacityUserUnknown: If the number of event participants is not limited in any way, write a rough estimate of the maximum number of participants. (This information will be used for statistical purposes).

infoTextAudience.course: If the course does not have a specific target group, you must leave the selection unchecked.
infoTextAudience.general: If the event does not have a specific target group, you must leave the selection unchecked.
infoTextAudience.volunteering: If the volunteering does not have a specific target group, you must leave the selection unchecked.

infoTextAudienceAge.course: If age restrictions apply to the course, set the age minimum and maximum age limit here.
infoTextAudienceAge.general: If age restrictions apply to the event, set the age minimum and maximum age limit here.
infoTextAudienceAge.volunteering: If age restrictions apply to the volunteering, set the age minimum and maximum age limit here.

course.paragraph1: A short description is displayed in some services when there is no space for a long description. It tells the most essential things about the course concisely.
course.paragraph2: The description is a longer and more detailed description of the content of the course.
course.paragraph3: Also record the course's responsibility information. Filling out the form only takes about 2 minutes and it opens in a new window. You will not lose the information filled in this form.

general.paragraph1: The description text includes language versions: Finnish and English, possibly also Swedish. Content specifically aimed at visitors must be at least in Finnish and English.
general.paragraph2: A short description is shown in some services when there is no room for a long description. It explains the most important things about the event in a concise way.
general.paragraph3: A description is a longer and more detailed explanation of the content of the event.
general.paragraph4: The text must not contain misspellings, umlauts, superlatives and superlatives, or the 'we' form, because then it refers to the city of Helsinki, not to the event itself.
general.paragraph5: In addition, the content of the event must comply with the City of Helsinki's guidelines, i.e. the City does not publish:
exclusions: political events (demonstrations, radical events related to elections or wars, etc.)
religious events (church services, prayers, although concerts are included in the calendar)
online events not related to Helsinki or the Metropolitan Area
events taking place in a private dwelling
not open to all, e.g. professional or investor events
dining without a programme; simply eating is not an event in itself
fund-raising events (except for charity events, where there is a programme)

volunteering.paragraph1: A short description is displayed in some services when there is no space for a long description. It tells the most essential things about the volunteering concisely.
volunteering.paragraph2: The description is a longer and more detailed description of the content of the volunteering.
volunteering.paragraph3: Also record the volunteering's responsibility information. Filling out the form only takes about 2 minutes and it opens in a new window. You will not lose the information filled in this form.

infoTextEnrolmentTime.course: If it is possible to register for the course, specify the start and end times of the registration here.
infoTextEnrolmentTime.general: If it is possible to register for the event, specify the start and end times of the registration here.
infoTextEnrolmentTime.volunteering: If it is possible to register for the volunteering, specify the start and end times of the registration here.

infoTextEventTimes1.course: To add a recurring course spanning over multiple days, there is an “Add Course Date” button and a “Recurring event” tool for a regularly recurring course.
infoTextEventTimes1.general: To add a recurring event spanning over multiple days, there is an “Add Event Date” button and a “Recurring event” tool for a regularly recurring event.
infoTextEventTimes1.volunteering: To add a recurring volunteering spanning over multiple days, there is an “Add Volunteering Date” button and a “Recurring event” tool for a regularly recurring volunteering.

infoTextEventTimes2.course: Enter the start date of the course and also the start time if the course starts at a specific time.
infoTextEventTimes2.general: Enter the start date of the event and also the start time if the event starts at a specific time.
infoTextEventTimes2.volunteering: Enter the start date of the volunteering and also the start time if the volunteering starts at a specific time.

infoTextEventTimes3.course: Also enter the end date as well as the end time if the course ends at a specific time.
infoTextEventTimes3.general: Also enter the end date as well as the end time if the event ends at a specific time.
infoTextEventTimes3.volunteering: Also enter the end date as well as the end time if the volunteering ends at a specific time.

infoTextEventTimes4.course: If the course is held more than once, you can add new dates to the course. If the course repeats regularly, you can add all times at once by selecting Recurring Course.
infoTextEventTimes4.general: If the event is held more than once, you can add new dates to the event. If the event repeats regularly, you can add all times at once by selecting “Recurring Event”.
infoTextEventTimes4.volunteering: If the volunteering is held more than once, you can add new dates to the volunteering. If the volunteering repeats regularly, you can add all times at once by selecting Recurring Volunteering.

form.infoTextEventTimes5: To delete an extra time, select the minus icon next to the time.

infoTextImage1.course: Always try to find a picture for the course. The image can be licensed under Creative Commons 4.0 BY, in which case the image can be shared and modified quite freely, or "Use limited to the course ". Some free-to-use illustrations can be found on the event images page.
infoTextImage1.general: Always try to find a picture for the event. The image can be licensed under Creative Commons 4.0 BY, in which case the image can be shared and modified quite freely, or "Use limited to the event ". Some free-to-use illustrations can be found on the event images page.
infoTextImage1.volunteering: Always try to find a picture for the volunteering. The image can be licensed under Creative Commons 4.0 BY, in which case the image can be shared and modified quite freely, or "Use limited to the volunteering ". Some free-to-use illustrations can be found on the event images page.

form.infoTextImage2: Before uploading, edit the image to fit for internet use and use a 3:2 horizontal aspect ratio, such as 1200 × 800 px. It is essential that the file size remains reasonable for mobile use, preferably less than 200 kilobytes (kb).
form.infoTextImage3: Name the image and give a short description of what the image contains.
form.infoTextImage4: Alt text improves accessibility because screen readers pass alt text to the user. So describe the content of the picture in an understandable way.

infoTextInfoLanguages.course: Select the languages to be used to input course information for this service.
infoTextInfoLanguages.general: Select the languages you want to use to describe the event information in Linked Events. Content specifically aimed at visitors has to be at least in Finnish and English.
infoTextInfoLanguages.volunteering: Select the languages to be used to input volunteering information for this service.

infoTextInLanguages.course: Select the languages ​used to communicate during the course.
infoTextInLanguages.general: Select the languages ​used to communicate during the event.
infoTextInLanguages.volunteering: Select the languages ​used to communicate during the volunteering.

infoTextKeywords.course: Add at least one keyword to the course that best describes the theme of the course. Start typing a keyword and select the keyword you want to add from the list below.
infoTextKeywords.general: Add at least one keyword to the event that best describes the theme of the event. Start typing a keyword and select the keyword you want to add from the list below.
infoTextKeywords.volunteering: Add at least one keyword to the volunteering that best describes the theme of the volunteering. Start typing a keyword and select the keyword you want to add from the list below.

form.infoTextLocation1: Enter the name or street address of the venue in the field and select the correct venue from the list. The search results are sorted by the number of events.

infoTextLocation2.course: If the course is only held remotely on the Internet, select Internet as the venue. The course URL is entered in the home page field and / or the course on social media fields.
infoTextLocation2.general: If the event is only held remotely on the Internet, select Internet as the venue. The event URL is entered in the home page field and / or the event on social media fields.
infoTextLocation2.volunteering: If the volunteering is only held remotely on the Internet, select Internet as the venue. The volunteering URL is entered in the home page field and / or the volunteering on social media fields.

form.infoTextLocation3: If the venue is found on the list, its location does not need to be described separately. However, you can provide additional information for finding the venue, such as the floor number or classroom name.
form.infoTextLocation4: If the exact venue is not found on the list, select the nearest street address as the venue, enter the name of the venue or other brief arrival instructions in the additional information field.
form.infoTextLocation5: If the location information has changed, update it in the location register. For services other than the city, add or update the information in the City Platform service.
form.infoTextLocation6: Select where the event will mainly take place from the Indoors/Outdoors options.

infoTextMainCategories.course: Select at least one main category. Using the correct main categories makes it easier to find the course.
infoTextMainCategories.general: Select at least one main category. Using the correct main categories makes it easier to find the event.
infoTextMainCategories.volunteering: Select at least one main category. Using the correct main categories makes it easier to find the volunteering.

infoTextOffers1.course: Indicate whether the course is free of charge. Enter a price in the form “5 €” for a paid course.
infoTextOffers1.general: Indicate whether the event is free of charge. Enter a price in the form “5 €” for a paid event.
infoTextOffers1.volunteering: Indicate whether the volunteering is free of charge. Enter a price in the form “5 €” for a paid volunteering.

infoTextOffers2.course: If the course has multiple prices, click “Add new pricing information” and enter the name of each price group (e.g. Children) in the “Additional price information” field.
infoTextOffers2.general: If the event has multiple prices, click “Add new pricing information” and enter the name of each price group (e.g. Children) in the “Additional price information” field.
infoTextOffers2.volunteering: If the volunteering has multiple prices, click “Add new pricing information” and enter the name of each price group (e.g. Children) in the “Additional price information” field.

infoTextProvider.course: Enter the name of the organization hosting the course if the organizer is not the same as the publisher.
infoTextProvider.general: Enter the name of the organization hosting the event if the organizer is not the same as the publisher.
infoTextProvider.volunteering: Enter the name of the organization hosting the volunteering if the organizer is not the same as the publisher.

paragraph1.general: Published information must be interesting to residents and/or visitors and be located in the Metropolitan Area.
paragraph1.course: Published information must be interesting to residents and/or visitors and be located in the Metropolitan Area.
paragraph1.volunteering: Published information must be interesting to residents and/or visitors and be located in the Metropolitan Area.

infoTextPublication.paragraph2: The type of event you choose can be published in the following channels:
infoTextPublication.paragraph3: or via the interface on other services.

paragraph4.general: Please only enter event information that has not yet been published on any of the services mentioned above.
paragraph4.course: Please only enter hobby information that has not yet been published on any of the services mentioned above.
paragraph4.volunteering: Please only enter event information that has not yet been published on any of the services mentioned above.

infoTextPublication.paragraph5: The event to be moderated must be announced at least one week before the event.

infoTextPublisher.course: Select the organization to be displayed as the course publisher. You do not need to make a selection if you only have rights to publish under one organization.
infoTextPublisher.general: Select the organization to be displayed as the event publisher. You do not need to make a selection if you only have rights to publish under one organization.
infoTextPublisher.volunteering: Select the organization to be displayed as the volunteering publisher. You do not need to make a selection if you only have rights to publish under one organization.

infoTextSocialMedia.course: Optional. Enter the SoMe links for the course in the URL field.
infoTextSocialMedia.general: Optional. Enter the SoMe links for the event in the URL field.
infoTextSocialMedia.volunteering: Optional. Enter the SoMe links for the volunteering in the URL field.

form.infoTextType1: Are you inputing an event or a course? The event is a one-off occasion and starts at a certain time, while a course may have several events and the activities are generally goal-oriented. In some cases, courses are also referred to as hobbies.
form.infoTextType2: The choice of event type affects how and in which services the event is displayed to the user.
form.infoTextUmrellaEvent1: Several different events can be grouped under the umbrella event. For example, a festival can be an umbrella event with several events underneath.
form.infoTextUmrellaEvent2: Umbrella event options can be left unchecked in most cases
form.infoTextUmbrellaSubEvent: If you wish to add this event under an umbrella event, you may do so from the associated

infoTextVideo1.course: If the course has a video, you can add its URL here.
infoTextVideo1.general: If the event has a video, you can add its URL here.
infoTextVideo1.volunteering: If the volunteering has a video, you can add its URL here.

form.infoTextVideo2: Name the video and give a brief description of the contents.
form.labelHasEnvironmentalCertificate: Event has received an EcoCompass or similar environmental certification

labelHasUmbrella.course: This course has an umbrella event.
labelHasUmbrella.general: This event has an umbrella event.
labelHasUmbrella.volunteering: This volunteering has an umbrella event.

labelInfoUrl.course: Website URL of the course homepage {{langText}}
labelInfoUrl.general: Website URL of the event homepage {{langText}}
labelInfoUrl.volunteering: Website URL of the volunteering homepage {{langText}}

labelIsUmbrella.course: This course is an umbrella event.
labelIsUmbrella.general: This event is an umbrella event.
labelIsUmbrella.volunteering: This volunteering is an umbrella event.

form.labelUserConsent: I have read the Data protection description and give my consent to the use of my data.

notificationNotAuthenticated.paragraph1: The City of Helsinki publishes information about events in the Helsinki Metropolitan Area free of charge, for example on the services tapahtumat.hel.fi and harrastukset.hel.fi. Event information will also be visible on other digital platforms that use the city's Linked Events interface.
notificationNotAuthenticated.paragraph2: You can continue to explore the service, but you will need to log in if you want to save changes.

form.tooltipEventIsUmbrella: A sub event cannot be an umbrella event.

postponeEventModal.text1: This function postpones the event to the future. After postponing, you can later enter a new time for the event.
postponeEventModal.text2: The following events will be postponed:
postponeEventModal.textPastEventAreNotUpdated: Please also note that the changes only apply to future events in the series. Past events in the series are not postponed when postponing the roof event.
postponeEventModal.title: Postpone event
postponeEventModal.titlePastEventAreNotUpdated: Past events in the series will not be postponed

updateEventModal.text1: Data is stored for all events in this series. Changes to these events will be lost. Are you sure you want to continue?
updateEventModal.text2: The data is updated in the following events
updateEventModal.textPastEventAreNotUpdated: Please also note that the changes only apply to future events in the series. Past events in the series are not edited when editing the umbrella event.
updateEventModal.title: Save event
updateEventModal.titlePastEventAreNotUpdated: Past events in the series will not be edited

askPermissionPage.pageDescription: Ask permission to Linked Events organisation.
askPermissionPage.placeholderJobDescription: Describe your role in the organization
askPermissionPage.placeholderName: Enter your first and last name or nickname
askPermissionPage.textSuccess: Your message has been successfully sent. We will contact you very soon!

contactPage.pageDescription: Send a bug report or feature request. Or send us some feedback about the service.
contactPage.placeholderName: Enter your first and last name or nickname
contactPage.textSuccess: Your message has been successfully sent. We will contact you very soon!

faq.textAddingEvents1: You must login to the service first. To do this, I need one of the following:
faq.textAddingEvents2: Once you are logged in, you can add events, but you will not be able to publish them yet. Contact us using the contact form and tell us which organization you need publishing rights for.
faq.textAddingToOwnProjects: Yes. The Linked Events interface is public and open to everyone. Its use is also permitted in commercial services in accordance with the terms of use.
faq.textEventFormNotWorking: Make sure that you are using one of these modern web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Opera or Safari). Other options to fix unexpected errors is to clear your browser cache or restart the browser.
faq.textEventNotShown: Events are always listed according to different search criteria. If no search criteria are specified, then the interface returns future events within the selected base organization with an event type of “event”. As a result, courses, for example, will not appear in search results unless specifically defined. Also, check that the event you added has been published and that its date is in the future.
faq.textImageRights: You must have rights to the image you uploaded. See section: attaching an image to events.
faq.textPublishingPermission: You can request permission rights to add events to your organisation from us. Remember to add detailed information about your role in the organisation.
faq.textRegistrationForRecurringEvent: Yes you can, but you need to create a separate registration for each event.
faq.textSlowRequests: First, check the search criteria to find only the information you need for your service. We also recommend that you keep the information in your own service, in which case you only need to retrieve the changed or added information from the Linked Events interface.
faq.titleAddingEvents: How do I enter events into Linked Events?
faq.titleAddingToOwnProjects: Can I use Linked Events in my own projects?
faq.titleEventFormNotWorking: Event form is not working as expected, what can I Do?
faq.titleEventNotShown: The event I added doesn't appear in the service, where's the problem?
faq.titleImageRights: Can I add any image to events?
faq.titlePublishingPermission: Who has rights for adding new public events?
faq.titleRegistrationForRecurringEvent: Can you enable registrations for recurring events?
faq.titleSlowRequests: API searches are slow - how do I make them faster?

helpPage.pageDescriptionApi: More information about the API (application protocol interface) of Linked Events.
helpPage.pageDescriptionControlPanel: How to use control panel and Linked events admin features.
helpPage.pageDescriptionDocumentation: Read more about Linked Events documentation and API design.
helpPage.pageDescriptionFaq: Frequently asked questions about Linked Events.
helpPage.pageDescriptionFeatures: Read about Linked Events features. Get familiar with event management and Linked Events API.
helpPage.pageDescriptionImageRights: More information about the image rights and licenses for Linked Events.
helpPage.pageDescriptionInstructions: Help and instructions how to use the service and the API.
helpPage.pageDescriptionSourceCode: Get a deeper look for Linked Events source code in Github.
helpPage.pageDescriptionTechnology: More information about the technology behind Linked Events.
helpPage.pageDescriptionTermsOfUse: Linked Events service Data Privacy and Terms of Use.
helpPage.pageTitleTermsOfUse: Data Privacy and Terms of Use

platformPage.pageDescription: Introduction to Linked Events platform and control panel.
platformPage.textApi: The public API allows you to retrieve events for your own service. You can also give us a tip about an existing databank  that should be incorporated into Linked Events.
platformPage.textEventManagement: The Linked Events control panel is used to enter events, courses, and volunteering assignments, and to manage related information and materials.
platformPage.textMainContent1: Linked Events is an open interface developed by the City of Helsinki for events, courses and for volunteering in the City of Helsinki. This site provides tools and instructions for managing events and documentation on how to use the public interface.
platformPage.textMainContent2: Events may be entered with the permission of the city. Events do not have to be organised by the city. You can enter multiple dates for an event. In this case, an umbrella event is automatically created for the event sequence.
platformPage.textMainContent3: You can enable registration for any event by filling up the information needed for the participation form.
platformPage.textRegistration: The Linked Registration control panel is used to manage registrations and participants for the event.
platformPage.textSupport: Contact us if you require more information or have concerns, or any suggestions on how we could improve the service. In the Support section, you will find more detailed information and a contact form.

registrationInstructionsPage.imageAltText1: After publishing an event: go to the Registration section in Linked Events. Press the Add New button.
registrationInstructionsPage.imageAltText2: Select the event for which you want to create a registration; you can also type in the field.
registrationInstructionsPage.imageAltText3: Select the input languages you wish to use and enter any registration instructions and additional text for the confirmation message in the languages you have chosen.
registrationInstructionsPage.imageAltText4: Please select the mandatory personal data fields on the registration form.
registrationInstructionsPage.imageAltText5: On the front page of the registration section, you will see a list of events for which registration has been created.
registrationInstructionsPage.imageAltText6: You can view the participants on the registration section home page by selecting the event from three-dot menu Show participants.

deleteImageModal.text: This action will permanently remove the image.
deleteImageModal.title: Confirm image deletion

form.labelAltText: Alternate image text for screen readers (alt text)

landingPage.highlight1Text: Events in Helsinki from the guided play park activities to world-class festivals.
landingPage.highlight2Text: Event information is spread through an open API to several sites for city residents to discover.
landingPage.highlight3Text: Linked Events is open source. Many cities have opted to use it for free.
landingPage.myHelsinkiDescription: MyHelsinki.fi is a service that brings together content about Helsinki’s offerings for visitors and businesses. The website helps to find information about the trends, attractions, restaurants and events in the city, as well as reveals tips from residents. The Think Sustainably -service offers recommendations for Helsinki's sustainable offerings.
landingPage.tapahtumatHelDescription: A new website that brings together the City of Helsinki's event offerings. Tapahtumat.hel.fi offers an easy-to-use event search, from which the user can search for events of interest to them, for example, by time, place or event category. The next version of the site also brings together the hobbies of children and young people offered by the city in one place.
landingPage.titlePartners: Services that already rely on Linked Events

logoutPage.text: You have been logged out of the service. Log back in or return to the home page.

header.label: The new Helsinki profile login will be introduced in mid-January 2024.
header.text:
The Google, YLE and Facebook login methods will be removed. At the same time, employees' AD authentication will change.
After the change, the Helsinki Profile service will be used for login, and users will be able to manage their own data in the city's various digital services.
With the introduction of the Helsinki Profile, access to previous contents will be disabled.
The change will also remove content production rights. In order to produce content, you should take the time to renew your content production rights.

maintenance.toast: On Wednesday 30.8. the Linked Events service will be updated, which means that login will not be possible.

notFound.text: The content you were looking for could not be found. Log in or return to the home page.

notSigned.text: You must be logged in to view this content. Log in or return to the home page.

registrationUserAccess.notificationTextAccessRights: Here you can give reading rights for this registration to another city employee or an external event organizer, or assign yourself a substitute with the same access rights as you.
registrationUserAccess.notificationTextSubstituteUser: Add yourself a substitute for possible absences. Based on this, the substitute is given the same access rights to this registration as you have. If you don't have a clear substitute, then put your predecessor as the substitute.

signup.helperExtraInfo: Enter here the information about possible allergies, special diets, accessibility or other special needs, if they are information necessary for participating in the event. We forward the information to the event organizer so that the safety and accessibility of the event can be ensured. By entering the data, you give your consent to the processing of the data. You can withdraw your consent by deleting the data.

inWaitingList.tooltip: Entrants have been added to the queue of registrants with a reserve place. Registration is confirmed only when a place in the queue becomes available. You will receive a notification by e-mail that the place has been confirmed.
